page.title: 06The Village Hall
page.content: The village hall was erected to commemorate those who died in the first World War. It has kitchen and toilet facilities and was renovated and brought up to modern safety standards in the mid- nineteen seventies. It is in constant use and has the services of a part-time hallkeeper. The Rifle Club and Womans Rural Institute,both organisations which are still very active in the village,have longest associations with the hall. Other clubs have come and gone but today there is a Play Group,set up in 1977 and run by local mothers;a Sports Club which began in Feb.1984 and caters for all ages and most recently a Keep Fit Class.The hall is used for a variety of village activities e.g. Concerts,Discoes,Parties,Meetings, Presentations and even Weddings.
